definitions.text: that which is contrary to the principles of justice or law
examples: he feels that you are in the wrong

definitions.text: any harm or injury resulting from a violation of a legal right
not correct; not in conformity with fact or truth
examples: the report in the paper is wrong
the clock showed the wrong time
found themselves on the wrong road

definitions.text: contrary to conscience or morality or law
examples: it is wrong for the rich to take advantage of the poor

definitions.text: not appropriate for a purpose or occasion

examples: something is wrong with the engine

definitions.text: based on or acting or judging in error
examples: it is wrong to think that way

definitions.text: not in accord with established usage or procedure
examples: the wrong way to shuck clams
it is incorrect for a policeman to accept gifts

definitions.text: used of the side of cloth or clothing intended to face inward

examples: it was the wrong moment for a joke

definitions.text: characterized by errors; not agreeing with a model or not following established rules; ; ; the wrong side of the road"

examples: he decided to reveal the details only after other sources had reported them incorrectly
